document_title: Bone spurs: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_name: gai-xuong.json_8_How to effectively prevent bone spurs
subsection_content:
Preventing bone spurs from forming is impossible if the condition is related to joint or spinal degeneration. However, some of the following measures can help reduce the risk of developing these extra bone spurs from other problems, including:
Wear shoes that fit your feet, have good cushioning and arch support; Build a nutritious diet rich in calcium and vitamin D to protect strong bones; Regularly exercise and exercise; Lose weight if necessary; See a doctor as soon as possible when there are any unusual symptoms in the joints (pain, swelling, stiffness...) for timely and effective intervention.

The hospital is also equipped with modern machinery and imaging equipment such as: Somatom Drive 768-slice CT scanner, new generation Magnetom Amira BioMatrix magnetic resonance machine, Artis Pheno robot, densitometer. bones, ultrasound machines...; Opmi Vario 700 Zeiss surgical microscope system, Meera-Maquet operating table... to be able to detect injuries early and effectively treat musculoskeletal diseases...

Basically, bone spurs are one of the warning signs that the joints are seriously damaged or degenerated. Therefore, to control this condition well, patients first need to effectively treat the root cause. In addition, don't forget to adopt a healthy lifestyle to improve joint mobility and improve the quality of daily life.
